newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - South Korean newspapers - July 28.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - South Korean newspapers - July 28.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy.
- President Kim Young-sam is expected to reshuffle the cabinet to create a more politically neutral administration and replace key posts in the ruling New Korea Party (NKP) next week.

- Lee Hoi-chang, chairman and presidential candidate of the ruling New Korea Party, faces turbulence within his party as members of an "anti-Lee Hoi-chang" faction are uncooperative and some show moves to support opposition presidential candidates.

- According to the LG Economic Research Institute, for the first time in five years, the number of layoffs and early retirements exceeded the number of new employees. This is mainly attributed to the economic slump and downsizing by corporations.
- South Korea and Japan will discuss ways to work closer under the World Trade Organization regime and other multilateral groups when trade ministers of the two countries meet in Seoul on Thursday.
